description.p: The slender elf cleaned her glasses with the corner of her cloak, as the dust began to settle around her. Her benefactor had paid her a handsome sum to locate this forgotten place, and after months of pouring over ancient tomes, she finally pieced together it's long-lost location. Now, she had a difficult choice to make. If she reported her findings to her benefactor, the temple would be stripped of its valuables. If she kept the location of her discovery hidden, then she could preserve the priceless knowledge contained within. For to a savant, knowledge is more precious then gold coins.

The elderly human warrior assessed the state of the soldiers under his command. They were exhausted and almost out of supplies. It was the tenth day of the siege, and the old warrior knew in his heart that no reinforcements would be coming to save them. He was too old to be of much use in battle, but if his soldiers followed his orders to the letter, and without hesitation, they just might have a fighting chance. He stood up, and for what could be the last time, donned his shield and drew his sword from its scabbard.

A young dwarf bent over his unconscious comrade in the midst of battle, his hands were shaking as he examined the unconscious soldier's wounds. The elders of his clan had spent a great deal of their fortune to send him to the best university gold could buy. All those hours spent in lectures, libraries, and observation, all for this moment. He thought back to all he had learned about field medicine and began to dress his comrade's wounds.

There are many intelligent people in the world, but few are true savants. Born with an innate desire to learn all they can, and the potential for a genius level intellect, savants spend their lives studying anything that those around them are willing to teach. Often recognized at an early age, their ravenous hunger for knowledge, draws them to great libraries, universities, and other places of higher learning. Willing to go to any lengths to access the hidden knowledge of the world, savants often turn to a life of adventuring. For a savant, no price is too steep to pay for a new discovery.

Despite their aptitude for learning, most savants seek to better themselves without having to depend other forces. Rejecting the patronage of powerful beings, and considering wizardry a shortcut to power, savants rely on their intellect alone, as they strive for perfection.

Savants hyper-focus on their area of academic study. They obsess and learn all they can about their area of expertise. This drive fuels every savant, and they are willing to put aside political, religious, or cultural divisions in order to learn. Once they have learned all academia can teach them, savants strike out into the world to advance their field of study .

Often at great cost to themselves, a savant will not stop researching, experimenting, and theorizing until they have made an indelible mark on their academic discipline. Whether they realize it or not, the ultimate goal burning within the heart of every savant is to uncover some lost or previously unknown truth about the universe.

When creating your savant, consider their upbringing and level of formal education. Were they the star pupil of the kingdom's university, or did they come from squal, fighting for any scrap of knowledge they could get their hands on? Consider why they became an adventurer rather than an academic. Have they advanced beyond study and look to the endless discoveries of a life of adventure?

You can make a savant quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Intelligence your highest ability score, followed by Dexterity. Second, choose the noble or sage background from the Player's Handbook.
As an savant, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d8 per savant level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per savant level after 1st
Armor: Light armor
Weapons: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, rapiers, shortswords
Tools: One set of artisan's tools of your choice
Saving Throws: Intelligence, Wisdom
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, History, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Persuasion, Religion, and Sleight of Hand

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) two simple weapons of your choice or (b) a rapier.
(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) a shortsword.
one set of artisan's tools of your choice.
leather armor and a scholar's pack.

setters.set: A brilliant mind who spends their life studying anything that those around them are willing to teach.
light armor and one skill of your choice from the savant skill list.

description.p: Beginning at 1st level, you can quickly analyze a foe, allowing you to discern their capabilities and land precise strikes. As bonus action on your turn, you can mark a creature within 60 feet that you can see, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Whenever you make a weapon attack against the marked creature, you can use your Intelligence, in place of your Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

Each time you hit the marked creature with an attack, or observe it for 1 minute, you learn one of the following characteristics of your choice: its Armor Class, maximum hit points, movement speed, or one of its ability scores.
As a bonus action, you can make an ability check that uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, targeting the creature.

description.p: The creature remains marked for 1 minute, unless you are incapacitated or mark another creature with this feature.

sheet.description: As bonus action on your turn, you can mark a creature within 60 feet that you can see, gaining the following benefits: Whenever you make a weapon attack against the marked creature, you can use your Intelligence, in place of your Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. Each time you hit the marked creature with an attack, or observe it for 1 minute, you learn one of the following characteristics of your choice: its Armor Class, maximum hit points, movement speed, or one of its ability scores. As a bonus action, you can make an ability check that uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, targeting the creature. The creature remains marked for 1 minute, unless you are incapacitated or mark another creature with this feature.

description.p: Your observant way of fighting allows you to anticipate and dodge attacks. Starting at 1st level, when you are not wearing any armor or wielding a shield, your Armor Class is equal to 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: When you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your Armor Class is equal to {{ac:unarmored defense savant}}.

description.p: You can recall picture perfect details from things you commit to memory. Starting at 1st level, if you spend at least 1 minute observing something, you can recall any information about it, at any point in the future, without requiring an ability check.
Examples of this may include books that you have read, a path that you have traveled, or a map that you have studied.

sheet.description: If you spend at least 1 minute observing something, you can recall any information about it, at any point in the future, without requiring an ability check.

description.p: Your ability to learn and retain new skills and languages is beyond compare. Starting at 2nd level, each time you finish a long rest, you can choose to learn one additional language, or gain proficiency with one tool, skill, or weapon of your choice, as long as there is an example for you to learn from (such as a willing teacher with that proficiency, a manual, or a book in a different language). You can only gain one proficiency or language from this feature per long rest.

You can learn a total number of additional languages and proficiencies through this feature equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 language or proficiency). When you choose to learn another language or proficiency while you are at maximum, you must choose one language or proficiency you learned through this feature to forget, at which point you immediately lose any knowledge of it.
When you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn a new language or proficiency at the end of each short or long rest.

sheet.description: Each time you finish a long rest, you can choose to learn one additional language, or gain proficiency with one tool, skill, or weapon of your choice, as long as there is an example for you to learn from (such as a willing teacher with that proficiency, a manual, or a book in a different language). You can only gain one proficiency or language from this feature per long rest. You can learn a total of {{intelligence:modifier}} additional languages and proficiencies through this feature (minimum of 1 language or proficiency). When you choose to learn another language or proficiency while you are at maximum, you must choose one language or proficiency you learned through this feature to forget, at which point you immediately lose any knowledge of it.

Each time you finish a short or long rest, you can choose to learn one additional language, or gain proficiency with one tool, skill, or weapon of your choice, as long as there is an example for you to learn from (such as a willing teacher with that proficiency, a manual, or a book in a different language). You can only gain one proficiency or language from this feature per rest. You can learn a total of {{intelligence:modifier}} additional languages and proficiencies through this feature (minimum of 1 language or proficiency). When you choose to learn another language or proficiency while you are at maximum, you must choose one language or proficiency you learned through this feature to forget, at which point you immediately lose any knowledge of it.

description.p: You can overexert your intellectual stamina when in need of useful insights or mental fortitude. Beginning at 2nd level, when you make an ability check or saving throw that uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can choose to add 1d6 to your roll. You can choose to add this bonus after you roll, but before you learn whether you succeed or fail.
You can use the feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
This bonus increases as you gain levels in this class; at 10th level (1d8), 15th level (1d10), and 20th level (1d12).

sheet.description: When you make an ability check or saving throw that uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can choose to add 1d6 to your roll. You can choose to add this bonus after you roll, but before you learn whether you succeed or fail.

When you make an ability check or saving throw that uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can choose to add 1d8 to your roll. You can choose to add this bonus after you roll, but before you learn whether you succeed or fail.

When you make an ability check or saving throw that uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can choose to add 1d10 to your roll. You can choose to add this bonus after you roll, but before you learn whether you succeed or fail.

When you make an ability check or saving throw that uses Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, you can choose to add 1d12 to your roll. You can choose to add this bonus after you roll, but before you learn whether you succeed or fail.

description.p: At 3rd level, choose an Academic Discipline: Archaeologist, Naturalist, Orator, Physician, Sleuth, or Tactician, each of which is detailed at the end of this class description. Your Academic Discipline grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 13th, and 17th level in this class.

sheet.description: Choose between Archaeologist, Naturalist, Orator, Physician, Sleuth, or Tactician, each of which is detailed at the end of the class description.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 6th, 8th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you canâ€™t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Your ability to react to the world around you is considerably faster than most creatures. Beginning at 5th level, you gain one additional reaction that you can take in each round of combat. A single effect can only trigger one reaction.
Upon reaching 17th level, your reflexes increase again, allowing you another reaction per round (for a total of 3).

sheet.description: You can take one additional reaction per round. A single effect can only trigger one of your reactions.
You can take two additional reactions per round. A single effect can only trigger one of your reactions.

description.p: Starting when you reach 5th level, your observational skills allow you to highlight your foe's weak points for yourself and your allies. When you, or a creature that you can see, hits the target of your Adroit Analysis with an attack, you can use your reaction to increase the damage of their attack by 1d10.
Starting at 11th level, the bonus damage you add to an attack with this reaction becomes 2d10.

sheet.description: When you, or a creature that you can see, hits the target of your Adroit Analysis with an attack, you can use your reaction to increase the damage of their attack by 1d10.
When you, or a creature that you can see, hits the target of your Adroit Analysis with an attack, you can use your reaction to increase the damage of their attack by 2d10.

description.p: Your mind can react to danger at a moments notice. Starting at 7th level, you gain a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1), and you cannot be surprised unless you are asleep or incapacitated.

sheet.description: You cannot be surprised unless you are asleep or incapacitated.

description.p: Your ability to educate others is peerless. Beginning at 9th level, when you finish a long rest, choose a number of willing creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and one tool, skill, or weapon proficiency, or one language you know. The chosen creatures gain that proficiency or learn that language until the end of your next long rest.
The proficiency or language you choose to teach with this feature can be one that you've acquired from Expert Student.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest, choose {{intelligence:modifier}} willing creatures (minimum of 1), and one tool, skill, or weapon proficiency, or one language you know. The chosen creatures gain that proficiency or learn that language until the end of your next long rest. The proficiency or language you choose to teach with this feature can be one that you've acquired from Expert Student.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, you can use your Potent Observation reaction when a friendly creature hits another creature with a weapon attack, even if the target is not marked by Adroit Analysis. You must be able to see both creatures.
Also, when you use Potent Observation when a creature hits the target of your Adroit Analysis with an attack you add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to the damage.

sheet.description: You can use your Potent Observation reaction when a friendly creature hits another creature with a weapon attack, even if the target is not marked by Adroit Analysis. You must be able to see both creatures. Also, when you use Potent Observation when a creature hits the target of your Adroit Analysis with an attack you add {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of +1) to the damage.

description.p: It is incredibly hard for your foes to mentally dominate you. Starting at 14th level, when you are forced to make a saving throw to resist being charmed, frightened, or stunned, you can expend a use of Unyielding Mind to automatically succeed.

sheet.description: When you are forced to make a saving throw to resist being charmed, frightened, or stunned, you can expend a use of Unyielding Mind to automatically succeed.

description.p: Your can predict attacks before they come to pass. Starting at 18th level, any creature marked by your Adroit Analysis has disadvantage on attack rolls they make against you, and you have advantage on any saving throw they force you to make.

sheet.description: Any creature marked by your Adroit Analysis has disadvantage on attack rolls they make against you, and you have advantage on any saving throw they force you to make.

description.p: Upon reaching 20th level, you realize the true genius-level potential of your mind. Your Intelligence and Wisdom scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

sheet.description: Your Intelligence and Wisdom scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

description.p: Specializing in the study of forgotten civilizations, ancient places, and uncharted lands, Archaeologists boldly walk into the dark and deadly places of the world that they may be illuminated by the light of knowledge. Archaeologists do their best to piece together the lost knowledge of past ages. They tend to feel a sad kinship with the lost civilizations that they study, and will go to great lengths not to destroy or offend their memory. For an Archaeologist, learning from the innovations, and mistakes, of the past is the best way to improve the present and move toward a better future.

sheet.description: Specializing in the study of forgotten civilizations, ancient places, and uncharted lands, Archaeologists boldly walk into the dark and deadly places of the world that they may be illuminated by the light of knowledge.

description.p: Your study of bygone eras grants you unique insight into all things ancient and forgotten. When you adopt this Academic Discipline at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the History and Investigation skills, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with these skills. If you are already proficient in History or Investigation you gain proficiency with another skill of your choice from the savant skill list.
In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: a language spoken by the creature, a special sense it has (such as darkvision), or its civilization of origin.

sheet.description: You can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: a language spoken by the creature, a special sense it has (such as darkvision), or its civilization of origin.

description.p: The places you explore are dangerous, and have honed your survival instincts. At 3rd level, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You can take the Use an Object action as a bonus action.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed.
You can use your Unyielding Mind reaction when you make a Dexterity ability check or saving throw.

If you spend 1 minute examining an object you can touch, you can ascertain its value, its civilization of origin, and its approximate age. If the item has any magical properties, you learn of them as if you had cast identify on the object. This does not allow you to identify magical curses.

sheet.description: You can take the Use an Object action as a bonus action. You can use your Unyielding Mind reaction when you make a Dexterity ability check or saving throw. If you spend one minute examining an object, you can ascertain its approximate monetary worth, its civilization of origin, and its approximate age. If the item has any innate magical properties, you learn of them as if you had cast the identify spell on the object. This feature doesn't allow you to discover magical curses.

description.p: You have gained an unfortunate familiarity with dangerous situations. Beginning at 6th level, when a creature you can see targets you with an opportunity attack, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on their attack roll. If the attacking creature is marked by Adroit Analysis, their opportunity attack automatically misses you.

In addition, when you are subjected to a trap that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see targets you with an opportunity attack, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on their attack roll. If the attacking creature is marked by Adroit Analysis, their opportunity attack automatically misses you. In addition, when you are subjected to a trap that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

description.p: You memorize every myth, legend, and folk tale that you find, knowing that each story is based on a grain of truth. Starting at 13th level, if you observe a person, place, or object for at least 1 hour, you can recall information about it as if you had cast the legend lore spell on that person, place, or object. You can use this ability as part of a short or long rest.

In addition, you can expend a use of your Expert Student feature to attune to a magic item that you don't normally meet the alignment, class, or race requirements for. You cannot use this feature to exceed your normal attunement limits.

sheet.description: If you observe a person, place, or object for at least 1 hour, you can recall information about it as if you had cast the legend lore spell on that person, place, or object. You can use this ability as part of a short or long rest. In addition, you can expend a use of your Expert Student feature to attune to a magic item that you don't normally meet the alignment, class, or race requirements for. You cannot use this feature to exceed your normal attunement limits.

description.p: Your frequent exposure to the magical effects present in ancient places has caused your body to develop an innate arcane ward. Beginning at 17th level, you gain resistance to damage from spells, magic traps, and other magical effects.

sheet.description: You gain resistance to damage from spells, magic traps, and other magical effects.

description.p: The Naturalist's classroom begins at the edges of civilization. They dedicate their lives to the study of the untamed plants, animals, and environments of the natural world. Naturalists are experts at predicting weather patterns, identifying toxic and edible plants, and deciphering the behaviors of wild animals. Due to their skills and knowledge of the wilderness, they are highly sought after as guides for adventuring parties. A dedicated Naturalist can safely navigate through arid deserts, frigid mountain ranges, and treacherous jungles.

sheet.description: The Naturalist's classroom begins at the very edges of civilization. They dedicate their lives to the study of the untamed plants, animals, and environments of the natural world.

description.p: Your study of the natural world grants you insights into the wild. When you adopt this Academic Discipline at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Animal Handling and Nature skills, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with these skills. If you are already proficient in either Animal Handling or Nature you gain proficiency with another skill of your choice from the savant skill list.
In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: its creature type, lowest ability score, or one of its traits (such as Keen Smell or Pack Tactics).

sheet.description: You can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: its creature type, lowest ability score, or one of its traits (such as Keen Smell or Pack Tactics).

description.p: Your knowledge of wild flora and fauna allows you to exploit their weak points when threatened by them. Starting at 3rd level, when you mark a beast, monstrosity, or plant with your Adroit Analysis, your weapon attacks against that creature score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

Additionally, you can spend 1 hour attuning yourself to the natural environment you currently reside in. While present in that environment, you have advantage on any Intelligence and Wisdom checks related to the native animals, plants, weather, and ecosystem of that environment. This attunement process can take place during a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you mark a beast, monstrosity, or plant with your Adroit Analysis, your weapon attacks against that creature score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20. Additionally, you can spend 1 hour attuning yourself to the natural environment you currently reside in. While present in that environment, you have advantage on any Intelligence and Wisdom checks related to the native animals, plants, weather, and ecosystem of that environment. This attunement process can take place during a short or long rest.

description.p: You can train others to face the dangers of the wild. Starting at 6th level, when you finish a long rest, choose a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) that can hear you, and one Survivalist Training feature below. You and the creatures you chose gain the benefits of that Survivalist Training until the end of your next long rest.

Dive Training. Creatures gain a swimming speed equal to their movement speed, and learn to hold their breath for a number of minutes equal to their Constitution modifier + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 minute).

Concealment Training. Creatures can move stealthily at a normal pace, have advantage on Stealth checks to hide in natural environments, and they can take the Hide action as a bonus action while in natural environments.

Endurance Training. Creatures ignore difficult terrain imposed by natural environments, they have advantage on saving throws to avoid exhaustion, and at the end of a short rest, their exhaustion level, if any, is reduced by 1.

Resilience Training. Creatures have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of extreme natural environments, and they gain resistance to one of the following damage types of your choice: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder.
Mountaineer Training. Creatures gain a climbing speed equal to their movement speed and they reduce any falling damage they take by an amount equal to your savant level.

You and the creatures you chose gain the benefits of that Survivalist Training until the end of your next long rest. Mountaineer Training: Creatures gain a climbing speed equal to their movement speed and they reduce any falling damage they take by {{level:savant}}.

description.p: Your insights into the hierarchies of wild beasts and the mindset of sentient plants allows you to exert your will over them for brief periods of time. Beginning at 13th level, you can use an action to force one beast, plant, or monstrosity within 30 feet that can see or hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw. The save DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by you for 1 hour.

While the creature is charmed, you can use a bonus action to issue commands to the creature, which it does its best to obey. If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction, it defends itself to the best of its ability.
Each time the creature takes damage, it can repeat its saving throw. On a successful save, the charm ends.
This ability does not require your concentration, but you can only control one creature at a time with this ability.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain allexpended uses when you finish a long rest.

On a failed save, the creature is charmed by you for 1 hour. While the creature is charmed, you can use a bonus actionto issue commands to the creature, which it does its best toobey. If the creature completes the order and doesn't receivefurther direction, it defends itself to the best of its ability. Each time the creature takes damage, it can repeat itssaving throw. On a successful save, the charm ends. This ability does not require your concentration, but you can only control one creature at a time with this ability.

description.p: You have become a leading authority on the natural world, and can maneuver with comfort in any environment. Upon reaching 17th level, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You can instantly attune to any natural environment togain the benefits of your Environmentalist ability.
You gain the benefits of all Survivalist Training features.
Creatures with an Intelligence score of 10 or lower havedisadvantage on saving throws to resist Wild Insight.

sheet.description: You can instantly attune to any natural environment togain the benefits of your Environmentalist ability. You gain the benefits of all Survivalist Training features. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 10 or lower have disadvantage on saving throws to resist Wild Insight.

description.p: Orators are true masters of linguistics and the spoken word.They often spend years studying the art of public speaking,and these wordsmiths use nothing but their wit and masteryof rhetoric to rebuff their foes and empower their allies. Withutmost confidence, they stride boldly into hostile situations,confident that they can win anyone with their eloquence.
Unlike others who rely on their charm, Orators emboldentheir allies and win over their foes with well reason logic.

sheet.description: Orators are true masters of linguistics and the spoken word.They often spend years studying the art of public speaking,and these wordsmiths use nothing but their wit and masteryof rhetoric to rebuff their foes and empower their allies.

description.p: Your expert grasp of philosophy and reasoning allows you to wield the spoken word as your weapon. When you adopt this Academic Discipline at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skils, and you proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make that uses these skills. You also use Intelligence, in place of Charisma, for any Deception or Persuasion checks you make. If you are already proficient with either of these skills you gain proficiency with another skill of your choice from the savant skill list.
In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: any languages you share, or if it is proficient in Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throws.

sheet.description: You use Intelligence, in place of Charisma, for any Deceptionor Persuasion checks you make. In addition, when you mark a target with Adroit Analysis,you learn of any languages you have in common, and either its Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma ability score.

description.p: Your mastery over spoken word allows you to dominate and inspire creatures that hear you. Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to speak one of the words of power below aloud, targeting a creature within 60 feet that can hear you. Creatures do not need to understand you to be affected.
Saving Throws. Some of the words of power you speak require the chosen target to make a saving throw to resist their effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Word of Power save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

description.p: Confound. You speak words that sow confusion in the mind of your foe, forcing the target to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must subtract your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) from any attack rolls they make before the start of your next turn.

Encourage. You speak words that motivate your allies. The creature can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to one attack roll or saving throw of their choice before the beginning of your next turn. They can add this bonus after they roll, but before they learn if the roll succeeds or fails.

Disorient. You speak words that disorient your foe, forcing them to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must subtract your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) from the first Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw they make before the start of your next turn.
Inspire. You speak aloud words that rouse your allies to fight through their injuries. The creature gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: You can use your action to speak one of the words of power below aloud, targeting a creature within 60 feet that can hear you. Creatures do not need to understand you to be affected. The save DC for your words of power is {{word power:dc}}. Confound: The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must subtract {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of 1) from any attack rolls they make before the start of your next turn. Encourage: The creature can add {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of +1) to one attack roll or saving throw of their choice before the beginning of your next turn. They can add this bonus after they roll, but before they learn if the roll succeeds or fails. Disorient: The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must subtract {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of 1) from the first Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw they make before the start of your next turn. Inspire: The creature gains {{intelligence:modifier}} temporary hit points (minimum of 1).

description.p: Your logical thought patterns prevent others from removing your mental agency. Starting at 6th level, you have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of enchantment spells, and you are immune to the charmed condition.
In addition, when you use your action to speak a word of power, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of enchantment spells, and you are immune to the charmed condition. In addition, when you use your action to speak a word of power, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

description.p: Your speech bears such power that it can crush the weak and inspire the disheartened. At 13th level, you learn the words of power below. You can speak these words a total number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Empower. You speak words of power that enliven all who hear them. A number of creatures of your choice equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) gain temporary hit points equal to your savant level and have advantage on the next ability check or saving throw they make.

Enfeeble. You speak words of power that cripple the mind of a creature, and force it to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned for 1 minute. Each time the creature takes damage it can repeat its saving throw. On a successful save, the stun ends.

sheet.description: You can speak these words {{intelligence:modifier}} times (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Empower: {{intelligence:modifier}} creatures of your choice (minimum of 1) gain {{level:savant}} temporary hit points and have advantage on the next ability check or saving throw they make. Enfeeble: The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target is stunned for 1 minute. Each time the creature takes damage it can repeat its saving throw. On a successful save, the stun ends.

description.p: It is rare that your well reasoned words fail to convince or impress your audience. Beginning at 17th level, whenever you make an Intelligence (Deception) or Intelligence (Persuasion) check, you treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

In addition, if you spend at least 1 minute talking with a creature, you can choose to charm them as if you had cast suggestion. You can have a number of creatures charmed in this way equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and charming another creature ends the oldest charm effect.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Deception) or Intelligence (Persuasion) check, you treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10. In addition, if you spend at least 1 minute talking with a creature, you can choose to charm them as if you had cast suggestion. You can have {{intelligence:modifier}} creatures charmed in this way (minimum of 1), and charming another creature ends the oldest charm effect.

description.p: Physicians bring their considerable intellect to bear healing the sick and tending to the wounded. They spend their lives studying the anatomy and inner workings of mortal beings, and use their knowledge to keep their allies in top condition. Using their medical training, they offer aid to those who don't have access to the luxury of divine or arcane healing magic.

sheet.description: Physicians are those that bring their considerable intellect to bear to heal the sick and wounded.

description.p: Your study of anatomy and physiology grants you insight into mundane medical practices. When you adopt this Academic Discipline at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Medicine skill and with the herbalism kit, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with these skills. You can also use Intelligence, in place of Wisdom, for any Medicine or herbalism kit checks you make. If you are already proficient in either of these skills, you gain proficiency with another skill of your choice from the savant skill list.
In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: the creature's current hit points or Hit Dice.

sheet.description: You can also use Intelligence, in place of Wisdom, for any Medicine or herbalism kit checks you make. If you are already proficient in Medicine or with the herbalism kit you gain proficiency with another skill of your choice from the savant skill list. In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: the creature's current hit points or Hit Dice.

description.p: You can apply your medicinal knowledge in battle. Starting at 3rd level, you can use the Combat Medic features below as an action on your turn, targeting a creature within your reach.

Adrenaline Boost. A creature that is blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, or poisoned can use its reaction to repeat a saving throw to end their condition, adding your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to their roll.

Crippling Strike. Make a weapon attack against the target. On hit, in addition to the normal damage of the attack, the creature's movement speed is reduced by an amount of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum 5 feet). This reduction lasts until the start of your next turn.
Dress Wounds. The target immediately gains temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your proficiency bonus, replacing any temporary hit points they currently have.
Healing Surge. The target can use its reaction to expend one of their Hit Dice to regain hit points equal to their Hit Die roll + their Constitution modifier + your Intelligence modifier.

Stabilize. You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points, automatically stabilizing them. The target can then choose to expend a Hit Die to immediately regain hit points equal to the maximum value of that Hit Die + their Constitution modifier.

sheet.description: You can use an action on your turn to do one of the following: Adrenaline Boost: A creature that is blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, or poisoned can use its reaction to repeat a saving throw to end their condition, adding {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of +1) to their roll. Crippling Strike: Make a weapon attack against the target. On hit, in addition to the normal damage of the attack, the creature's movement speed is reduced {{cripple strike:ft}} feet (minimum 5 feet). This reduction lasts until the start of your next turn. Dress Wounds: The target immediately gains temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + {{proficiency}}, replacing any temporary hit points they currently have. Healing Surge: The target can use its reaction to expend one of their Hit Dice to regain hit points equal to their Hit Die roll + their Constitution modifier + {{intelligence:modifier}}. Stabilize: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points, automatically stabilizing them. The target can then choose to expend a Hit Die to immediately regain hit points equal to the maximum value of that Hit Die + their Constitution modifier.

description.p: You can nimbly move about the battlefield to administer aid to your allies and harry your enemies. Beginning at 6th level, when you use your action to stabilize a creature, restore hit points, or grant temporary hit points, you gain the benefits of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.
In addition, when you use a Combat Medic feature as an action on your turn, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on that same turn.

sheet.description: When you use your action to stabilize a creature, restore hit points, or grant temporary hit points, you gain the benefits of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn. In addition, when you use a Combat Medic feature as an action on your turn, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on that same turn.

description.p: Your knowledge of medical science allows you to perform greater feats of healing, on and off the battlefield. At 13th level, you gain the Combat Medic features below. Once you use one of the features below, you cannot use another one until you complete a short or long rest.

Regenerate. The target regains 4d8 hit points. For the next ten minutes, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns. If they have a severed body part, you can hold it to the stump and instantaneously reattach it.

Restorative Boost. You touch a creature and immediately end one of the following effects: a reduction to an ability score, a reduction to its hit point maximum, one level of exhaustion, or the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, or poisoned condition.

Resuscitate. You touch a humanoid creature that has died within the last minute. It immediately returns to life with 1 hit point. This feature cannot bring back a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore missing body parts.

For the next ten minutes, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns. If they have a severed body part, you can hold it to the stump and instantaneously reattach it. This feature cannot bring back a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore missing body parts.

description.p: Your knowledge of medicine and anatomy is without peer. Starting at 17th level, when you restore hit points or grant temporary hit points to a creature, it gains the maximum amount of hit points, in place of rolling.
In addition, any creature within 30 feet of you that expends Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of a short rest can treat their expended Hit Dice as their maximum roll.

sheet.description: When you restore hit points or grant temporary hit points to a creature, it gains the maximum amount of hit points, in place of rolling. In addition, any creature within 30 feet of you that expends Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of a short rest can treat their expended Hit Dice as their maximum roll.

description.p: Excelling at unraveling mysteries and uncovering secrets, the archetypal Sleuth possesses an uncanny ability to read the intent of other creatures. The often spend their lives working against those who look to deceive the innocent and take advantage of the common trust. Their considerable intellect stands in the way of thieves' guilds, monstrous shapeshifters, and officials who abuse their authority. With a keen wit and masterful powers of observation, Sleuths are well equipped to expose and defeat those who hide in the shadows.

sheet.description: Excelling at unraveling mysteries and uncovering secrets, the archetypal Sleuth possesses an uncanny ability to read the intent of other creatures.

description.p: You keen observational skills allow you to discern fact from falsehood. When you adopt this Academic Discipline at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in Insight and Investigation, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of these proficiencies. If you already have proficiency in either of these skills, you gain proficiency with another skill of your choice from the savant skill list.
In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: the creature's alignment, if its current form its true form, or if it is proficient with thieves' tools.

sheet.description: You can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: the creature's alignment, if its current form its true form, or if it is proficient with thieves' tools.

description.p: Your keen sight allows you to notice even the tiniest details and weakness. At 3rd level, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You can take the Search action as a bonus action.
You have advantage on any ability check you make to see through illusions or determine if a creature is lying to you.
When you make a weapon attack against the target of your Adroit Analysis, you can expend a use of Unyielding Mind, adding the bonus to the result of yoru attack roll.
Once per turn, when you hit the target of your Adroit Analysis with a weapon attack, you can choose to re-roll the damage dice, but you must use the new roll.

sheet.description: You can take the Search action as a bonus action. You have advantage on any ability check you make to see through illusions or determine if a creature is lying to you. When you make a weapon attack against the target of your Adroit Analysis, you can expend a use of Unyielding Mind, adding the bonus to the result of yoru attack roll. Once per turn, when you hit the target of your Adroit Analysis with a weapon attack, you can choose to re-roll the damage dice, but you must use the new roll.

description.p: You have an almost supernatural sense that allows you to avoid approaching danger. Starting at 6th level, when a creature hits you with an attack, you can expend a use of Unyielding Mind as a reaction, adding the bonus to your Armor Class against that attack.

sheet.description: When a creature hits you with an attack, you can expend a use of Unyielding Mind as a reaction, adding the bonus to your Armor Class against that attack.

description.p: Your line of work has granted you an unfortunate familiarity with the dangerous underbelly of civilization. Beginning at 6th level, once you spend a long rest in a settlement, you have advantage on any Intelligence (Investigation) check you make related to that settlement, its culture, or any active factions.

The best way to get reliable information is from unreliable people. For you, carousing (activities such as drinking and gambling) counts as resting, so long as you deal no damage. You can spend a short rest carousing, but you must sleep for at least 4 hours to gain the benefits of a long rest.

sheet.description: Once you spend a long rest in a settlement, you have advantage on any Intelligence (Investigation) check you make related to that settlement, its culture, or any active factions. The best way to get reliable information is from unreliable people. For you, carousing (activities such as drinking and gambling) counts as resting, so long as you deal no damage. You can spend a short rest carousing, but you must sleep for at least 4 hours to gain the benefits of a long rest.

description.p: It is rare that you miss even the smallest inconsistency or detail when investigating or looking to exploit a weakness. Starting at 13th level, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: When you make an Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Insight) check you can treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10.
You gain a bonus to your passive Insight and passive Perception scores equal to your Intelligence modifier.
You automatically detect and see through illusions cast at a level equal to your Intelligence modifier or lower.
Once per turn, you can re-roll the bonus damage from Potent Observation, but you must use the new roll.

sheet.description: When you make an Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Insight) check you can treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10. You gain a bonus to your passive Insight and passive Perception scores of {{intelligence:modifier}}. You automatically detect and see through illusions cast at level {{intelligence:modifier}} or lower. Once per turn, you can re-roll the bonus damage from Potent Observation, but you must use the new roll.

description.p: Your insight into the weak points of your foes allows you and your allies to exploit them with ruthless efficiency. Beginning at 17th level, when you, or a creature that you can see, hits the target of your Adroit Analysis with a weapon attack, you can use to your reaction to turn the attack into a critical hit.
Once you use this reaction, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: When you, or a creature that you can see, hits the target of your Adroit Analysis with a weapon attack, you can use to your reaction to turn the attack into a critical hit.

description.p: All successful monarchs, conquerors, and revolutions have a master strategist that is responsible for their success on the battlefield. Known as Tacticians, these intelligent leaders are always one step ahead of their enemies, and strive to have a plan for every eventuality. They know the strategies that lead to glorious victory, and those that end in utter ruin. Alone, a single Tactician is a minor threat, but with powerful allies to rally and command, a Tactician becomes a formidable force, capable of toppling entire regimes if left to their devices.

sheet.description: All successful monarchs, conquerors, and revolutions have a master strategist that is responsible for their success on the battlefield.

description.p: You have dedicated your life to the history of conquest and war. When you adopt this Academic Discipline at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the History skill, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any History check you make. If you are already proficient in this skill, you instead gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the savant skill list.

You have also learned to arm yourself for battle. You gain proficiency with all medium armor, shields, and all martial weapons without the heavy property. In addition, when you wear light or medium armor, you can use your Intelligence, in place of Dexterity, when calculating your Armor Class.
In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: one resistance, immunity, or vulnerability.

sheet.description: You have learned to arm yourself for battle. You gain proficiency with all medium armor, shields, and all martial weapons without the heavy property. In addition, when you wear light or medium armor, you can use your Intelligence, in place of Dexterity, when calculating your Armor Class. In addition, you can learn the following characteristics with Adroit Analysis: one resistance, immunity, or vulnerability.

description.p: You leverage your deep knowledge of warfare and tactics to direct your allies to where they will be most effective on the battlefield. Starting at 3rd level, you can use an action on your turn to issue one of the Orders below, targeting one creature within 60 feet, other than yourself, that can see or hear you. A creature can only benefit from one Order at a time.

Attack Order. Your Order emboldens an ally to take to the offensive. The next time the target of this Order takes the Attack action before the start of your next turn, they make one additional weapon attack as part of that action.

Defensive Order. Your Order motivates an ally to reinforce their defensive position. Until the start of your next turn, the target of this Order gains a bonus to their Armor Class equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

Rallying Order. Your Order provides strategic insight to an ally moving about the battlefield. The target of this Order can use their reaction to immediately move up to their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Steadfast Order. Your Order inspires creatures to stand their ground and give no quarter. Until the start of your next turn, the target of this Order gains a bonus to any Strength and Constitution ability checks and saving throws they make equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1)

sheet.description: You can use an action on your turn to issue one of the Orders below, targeting one creature within 60 feet, other than yourself, that can see or hear you. A creature can only benefit from one Order at a time. Attack Order: The next time the target of this Order takes the Attack action before the start of your next turn, they make one additional weapon attack as part of that action. Defensive Order: Until the start of your next turn, the creature targeted by this Order gains a bonus to their Armor Class of {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of 1). Rallying Order: The target of this Order can use their reaction to immediately move up to their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Steadfast Order: A creature targeted by this Order can add {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of 1) to any Strength or Constitution checks or saving throws they make before the start of your next turn.

description.p: Your position as a leader, both on and off the field of battle, doesn't allow you to the privilege of succumbing to your base instincts. Starting at 6th level, you have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of enchantment spells, and you are immune to the frightened condition.

In addition, you can issue Orders to those who follow you, even in the midst of battle. When you use your action to issue an Order, you can make one weapon attack against a creature marked by Adroit Analysis as a bonus action on that turn.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of enchantment spells, and you are immune to the frightened condition. In addition, you can issue Orders to those who follow you, even in the midst of battle. When you use your action to issue an Order, you can make one weapon attack against a creature marked by Adroit Analysis as a bonus action on that turn.

description.p: Your knowledge of war and experience leading soldiers into battle allows you to coordinate multiple allies. Beginning at 13th level, when you use your action to issue an Order, you can issue the same Order to another creature within range.

As you gain levels in this class, your ability to command and coordinate increases again. Starting when you reach 17th level, when you use your action to issue an Order, you target up to three creatures within range with that Order.

sheet.description: When you use your action to issue an Order, you can issue the same Order to another creature within range.
When you use your action to issue an Order, you target up to three creatures within range with that Order.

description.p: Your wondrous tactical mind places you among the greatest commanders of military history, and your presence on the battlefield inspires heroic action in those who fight alongside you. Beginning at 17th level, when you issue an Order to a creature, the target immediately gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

sheet.description: When you issue an Order to a creature, the target immediately gains {{intelligence:modifier}} temporary hit points (minimum of 1 hit point).
